instructions: Continue along the Charles River paths

metadata.title: Kayak the Relaxing Charles River Esplanade in Boston
metadata.description:
Charles River Esplanade Boston is a great place for walking or kayaking.  In this kayak tour video.  I paddle through the Charles River Esplanade, and return to Charles River Canoe and Kayak on the Cambridge side of the Charles River.  The video starts with a view of MIT and the Harvard Bridge then proceeds through the Charles River Esplanade.  I encounter wildlife such as swans and ducks and kayakers along the way.  There is a view of Boston and the Longfellow Bridge along the way.

The Charles River Esplanade is a popular recreational area located in Boston, Massachusetts. It stretches for 3 miles along the banks of the Charles River and is a favorite spot for walkers, runners, cyclists, and boaters. The Esplanade features paved walkways, playgrounds, athletic fields, and a number of public art installations. It is also home to the Hatch Memorial Shell, an outdoor amphitheater that hosts a variety of musical and cultural events throughout the year, including the Boston Pops Fireworks Spectacular on the Fourth of July.

Originally constructed in the early 20th century as part of the "City Beautiful" movement, the Charles River Esplanade has undergone a number of renovations over the years to improve accessibility and safety. Today, it is one of Boston's most beloved outdoor spaces, providing a peaceful oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of city life. Whether you're looking for a place to exercise, enjoy a picnic, or simply soak up some sun and scenery, the Charles River Esplanade is the perfect destination.

The kayak was rented from and returned to Charles River Canoe and Kayak.  Charles River Canoe and Kayak is located on Broad Canal in Kendall Square.  

I hope you enjoyed the video!
If you like what you’ve seen, please feel free to subscribe:
https://www.youtube.com/@HikeWalkPaddle?sub_confirmation=1

If you’ve found my content useful, “Buy Me a Coffee” to support my hobby:
https://www.buymeacoffee.com/HikeWalkPaddle

Paddle Boston- Charles River Canoe and Kayak:
https://paddleboston.com/rentals/our-locations/cambridge-at-kendall-square/

Key Moments:
View of Mass Ave. Bridge and Cambridge 0:00
Enter Charles River Esplanade Pond0:16
Esplanade Canals 1:11
Swan 1:30
Fellow Kayakers 2:01
Exit Charles River Esplanade 3:44
Cormorant 4:17
Longfellow Bridge 4:56
Entrance to Broad Canal 5:32
Charles River Canoe and Kayak 6:30

👀 Visit my website here: https://www.HikeWalkPaddle.com 👀

metadata.title: Charles River Esplanade
metadata.summary: The Charles River Esplanade is a park in the Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. Owned by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, it is located on the south bank of the Charles River Basin and comprises part of the Charles River Reservation. The park was dedicated in 1910 as the Boston Embankment. The Esplanade went through a major expansion from 1928 to 1936.
metadata.snippet: The Charles River Esplanade is a park in the Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, Massachusetts, United States. Owned by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, it is located on the south bank of the Charles River Basin and comprises part of the Charles River Reservation. The park was dedicated in 1910 as the Boston Embankment. The Esplanade went through a major expansion from 1928 to 1936.
